definition: to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)
abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

sentences.english: Chinese people has never regarded human beings as the hightest creature among everything else since ancient times.
sentences.chinese: 中华民族自古以来从来不把人看作高于一切。

sentences.english: Calvinism was the most convenient religion since the days of the ancients.
sentences.chinese: 加尔文主义是自古以来最方便的宗教。

sentences.english: In ancient times, the people of many civilized countries used propolis as medicine to treat inflammations.
sentences.chinese: 自古以来，蜂胶被用作天然消炎药物。

sentences.english: They have been easily extracted since ancient times by soaking wood ashes in water.
sentences.chinese: 自古以来，人们用水浸泡木灰就很容易滤取出它们。

sentences.english: Formerly known as the Western Territory, Xinjiang has been an inalienable part of China since ancient times.
sentences.chinese: 新疆古称西域，自古以来就是中国不可分割的一部分。

sentences.english: It's a primarily, historically there's a lot of, it has a very heavy Jewish community.
sentences.chinese: 基本上，那里自古以来就有很多，犹太人聚集区。

sentences.english: Since ancient time, plutus cat has been regarded as a mascot for wealth and luck in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 招财猫自古以来被日本视为招财招福的吉祥物。

sentences.english: People have dreamt of immortality since time immemorial .
sentences.chinese: 人们自古以来就梦想着永垂不朽。

sentences.english: Since ancient times, Tibetan and Chinese peoples have lived as neighbors.
sentences.chinese: 中文版是“藏汉两个民族自古以来毗邻而居。”

sentences.english: Taking nourishing food in winter to build up health has been used as the usual health care method since ancient time.
sentences.chinese: 冬季进补是我国人民自古以来常用的自身保健方法。

sentences.english: Ever since the ancient times the literati and warriors had conquered the world in drasticly different ways.
sentences.chinese: 自古以来，文人与武人的征服方式，就根本不同。

sentences.english: The folk financing existence history is long-standing in our country.
sentences.chinese: 民间融资在我国自古以来就已存在。

sentences.english: In fact, since ancient times, the ingenious combination of poetry paintings of many people.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，自古以来，将诗书画结合巧妙的人大有人在。

sentences.english: Since ancient times, Chinese were courteous image of modesty.
sentences.chinese: 自古以来中国人就以谦谦有礼的形象而闻名于世。

sentences.english: The traditional morals of Rome nation was handed down through generations from ancient times.
sentences.chinese: 罗马民族自古以来就有一种世代相袭的传统美德。

sentences.english: They said that historically, they could always take what they wanted.
sentences.chinese: 他们说，自古以来，他们都是任取所需。

definition: since ancient times/it has ever been the case that/see also 自古以來|自古以来[zi4 gu3 yi3 lai2]
people from ancient times/the ancients/the late (i.e. person who has passed away)
lit. source is distant and the flow is long (idiom); fig. sth goes back to the dim and distant past/a lot of water has flowed under the bridge since then
among the people/popular/folk/non-governmental/involving people rather than governments
at all times and in all places (idiom)
